page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Duffield is an ancient village mentioned in the{Domesday book}as {Duvelle.}There is the site of a medieval castle and there is{Duffield {Hall,}the village manor house later turned into a private school and now the headquarters of the{Derbyshire {Building Society. The village is situated where the {Ecclesborne brook}joins the river {Derwent.}There is also the busy{A6 main road running through the centre. In the village there is a colour works, a laundry and a sawmill.However the village is today primarily a commuter,dormitory town for the east midlands area. During the last thirty years the population has increased to around 5000 people as several housing estates have been built.It is still increasing in size but at a slower rate.
